email.title: Email
email.description: The username of your Comfort Cloud (Panasonic ID) account.

password.title: Password
password.description: The password of your Comfort Cloud (Panasonic ID) account.

key2fa.title: 2FA key
key2fa.description: 2FA key received from Panasonic (32 characters). Note: This field is currently not required to make this plugin work, but Panasonic already requires 2FA (code or SMS, recommended code) to log in to Comfort Cloud, so it may be required soon.

name.title: Plugin Name
name.description: Name of the plugin in Homebridge log.

refreshInterval.title: Refresh interval
refreshInterval.description: Note: More frequent refresh would result in too much daily number of requests to the Panasonic server, which could result in an account lock for 24 hours, or even a complete API lock.

excludeDevices.title: Exclude Devices
excludeDevices.description: By default this plugin will add all devices from Comfort Cloud. To exclude one or more, put comma separated names or serial numbers of devices, E.G.: 'CS-Z50VKEW+4962605183,Bedroom AC,CS-Z50VKEW+4962605184,My AC unit'.

appVersionOverride.title: Comfort Cloud app version (override)
appVersionOverride.description: Leave this field empty to automatically fetch the latest version from the App Store and if that fails, it will use the last known working value which is hard-coded. Filling in this field will make the entered version used (automatic overwriting of versions from the App Store will not work).

suppressOutgoingUpdates.title: Suppress outgoing devices updates
suppressOutgoingUpdates.description: When enabled, changes in the Home app will not be sent to Comfort Cloud. Useful for testing your installation without constantly switching the state of your AC.

logsLevel.title: Logs Level
logsLevel.description: Logs level. Note: to see debug messages in logs it is also required to enable Debug in Homebridge Settings.

name.title: Name or serial number
name.description: Device name (as it is in Comfort Cloud account) or serial (E.G.: CS-Z50VKEW+2462503161).

autoMode.title: Auto Mode
autoMode.description: HomeKit has only 3 modes: Auto, Cool, Heat but Panasonic additionally has Fan and Dry. Choose what mode to be turned on after selecting the Auto mode in HomeKit: Fan mode, Dry mode or Auto mode (by default).

oscilateSwitch.title: Oscilate Switch
oscilateSwitch.description: HomeKit has only one 'Oscillate' switch, but most Panasonic ACs have more options: Nanoe, Eco Navi, Inside Cleaning and Swing mode have two swing directions. Decide what the switch should control: Swing Mode, Nanoe, Eco Navi or Inside Cleaning.

forceSwing.title: Force Swing
forceSwing.description: Swing value with each state change made with HomeKit (e.g. activation).

forceNanoe.title: Force Nanoe
forceNanoe.description: Nanoe value with each state change made with HomeKit (e.g. activation).

forceEcoNavi.title: Force Eco Navi
forceEcoNavi.description: Eco Navi value with each state change made with HomeKit (e.g. activation).

forceInsideCleaning.title: Force Inside Cleaning
forceInsideCleaning.description: Inside Cleaning value with each state change made with HomeKit (e.g. activation).

swingModeDirections.title: Swing Mode Directions
swingModeDirections.description: Desired swing direction(s) activated when swing is switched on.

swingModeDefaultPositionUpDown.title: Swing Mode Default Position (Up-Down)
swingModeDefaultPositionUpDown.description: Desired position of the Up-Down flaps when swing is switched off or the swing directions setting is Left-Right only.

swingModeDefaultPositionLeftRight.title: Swing Mode Default Position (Left-Right)
swingModeDefaultPositionLeftRight.description: Desired position of the Left-Right flaps when swing is switched off or the swing directions setting is Up-Down only.

exposeOutdoorUnit.title: Expose Outdoor Unit
exposeOutdoorUnit.description: When enabled it will create a dummy temperature sensor which will display the temperature from outdoor unit. This can be used for monitoring or automation purposes.

minHeatingTemperature.title: Minimum heating temperature (override)
minHeatingTemperature.description: The default heating temperature range is 16-30°C. Some Panasonic ACs have an additional heating mode for the range of 8-15°C. You can use this setting to adjust the minimum value. Leave it empty to use the default value.

layout.title: Account
layout.description: Enter your Panasonic Comfort Cloud login details.

layout.title: Devices
layout.description: All devices are automatically added from Comfort Cloud. Here add only those devices for which you want to apply separate settings or devices that you want to exclude.
